level-up.name: rock-tomb
level-up.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers
the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

level-up.name: block
level-up.description:
The user blocks the target’s way with arms spread
wide to prevent escape.
level-up.effect:
The target cannot switch out normally.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect ends when the user leaves the field.

The target may still escape by using baton pass, u turn, or a shed shell.

Both the user and the target pass on this effect with baton pass.

level-up.name: mud-shot
level-up.description:
The user attacks by hurling a blob of mud at the
target. This also lowers the target’s Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

level-up.name: imprison
level-up.description:
If opposing Pokémon know any move also known by
the user, they are prevented from using it.
level-up.effect: Prevents any Pokémon on the opposing side of the field from using any move the user knows until the user leaves the field.  This effect is live; if the user obtains new moves while on the field, these moves become restricted.  If no opposing Pokémon knows any of the user's moves when this move is used, this move will fail.

level-up.name: punishment
level-up.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power starts at 60 and is increased by 20 for every stage any of the target's stats has been raised, capping at 200.  Accuracy and evasion modifiers do not increase this move's power.

level-up.name: bulldoze
level-up.description:
The user strikes everything around it by stomping
down on the ground. This lowers the Speed stats of
those hit.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

level-up.name: rock-throw
level-up.description:
The user picks up and throws a small rock at the
target to attack.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: extrasensory
level-up.description:
The user attacks with an odd, unseeable power.
This may also make the target flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: swords-dance
level-up.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

level-up.name: earth-power
level-up.description:
The user makes the ground under the target erupt
with power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: rock-slide
level-up.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: earthquake
level-up.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

level-up.name: sandstorm
level-up.description:
A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all
combatants except Rock, Ground, and Steel types.
It raises the Sp. Def stat of Rock types.
level-up.effect:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

level-up.name: fissure
level-up.description:
The user opens up a fissure in the ground and drops
the target in. The target faints instantly if this
attack hits.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock on, mind reader, and no guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

level-up.name: stone-edge
level-up.description:
The user stabs the target from below with
sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

level-up.name: hammer-arm
level-up.description:
The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist.
It lowers the user’s Speed, however.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Speed by one stage.

level-up.name: outrage
level-up.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two to three
turns. The user then becomes confused.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

tutor.name: snore
tutor.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
tutor.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: outrage
tutor.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two to three
turns. The user then becomes confused.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

tutor.name: sleep-talk
tutor.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
tutor.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

tutor.name: iron-tail
tutor.description:
The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: role-play
tutor.description:
The user mimics the target completely, copying the
target’s Ability.
tutor.effect:
User's ability is replaced with the target's until the user leaves the field.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If the target has flower gift, forecast, illusion, imposter, multitype, stance change, trace, wonder guard, or zen mode, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

tutor.name: superpower
tutor.description:
The user attacks the target with great power.
However, this also lowers the user’s Attack and
Defense stats.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

tutor.name: knock-off
tutor.description:
The user slaps down the target’s held item, and that
item can’t be used in that battle. The move does
more damage if the target has a held item.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

If the target has multitype or sticky hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.

tutor.name: block
tutor.description:
The user blocks the target’s way with arms spread
wide to prevent escape.
tutor.effect:
The target cannot switch out normally.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect ends when the user leaves the field.

The target may still escape by using baton pass, u turn, or a shed shell.

Both the user and the target pass on this effect with baton pass.

tutor.name: gravity
tutor.description:
This move enables Flying-type Pokémon or Pokémon
with the Levitate Ability to be hit by Ground-type
moves. Moves that involve flying can’t be used.
tutor.effect:
For five turns (including this one), all immunities to ground moves are disabled.  For the duration of this effect, the evasion of every Pokémon on the field is lowered by two stages.  Cancels the effects of bounce, fly, and sky drop.

Specifically, flying Pokémon and those with levitate or that have used magnet rise are no longer immune to ground attacks, arena trap, spikes, or toxic spikes.

bounce, fly, sky drop, high jump kick, jump kick, and splash cannot be used while this move is in effect.

*Bug*: If this move is used during a double or triple battle while Pokémon are under the effect of sky drop, Sky Drop's effect is not correctly canceled on its target, and it remains high in the air indefinitely.  As Sky Drop prevents the target from acting, the only way to subsequently remove it from the field is to faint it.

tutor.name: earth-power
tutor.description:
The user makes the ground under the target erupt
with power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: stealth-rock
tutor.description:
The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the
opposing team. The trap hurts opposing Pokémon
that switch into battle.
tutor.effect:
Spreads sharp rocks around the opposing field, damaging any Pokémon that enters the field for 1/8 its max HP.  This damage is affected by the entering Pokémon's susceptibility to rock moves.

rapid spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.

machine.name: fly
machine.description:
The user flies up into the sky and then strikes its target
on the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User flies high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, twister, and whirlwind still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: calm-mind
machine.description:
The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its
spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: bulk-up
machine.description:
The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body,
raising both its Attack and Defense stats.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: hyper-beam
machine.description:
The target is attacked with a powerful beam.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: smack-down
machine.description:
The user throws a stone or similar projectile to
attack the target. A flying Pokémon will fall to the
ground when it’s hit.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the target's immunity to ground-type damage.  This effect removes any existing Ground immunity due to levitate, magnet rise, or telekinesis, and causes the target's flying type to be ignored when it takes Ground damage.

If the target isn't immune to Ground damage, this move will fail.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop, and ends the effect of Bounce or Fly.

machine.name: earthquake
machine.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: dig
machine.description:
The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on
the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: psychic
machine.description:
The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: brick-break
machine.description:
The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break
barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
machine.effect: Destroys any light screen or reflect on the target's side of the field, then inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: sludge-wave
machine.description:
The user strikes everything around it by swamping
the area with a giant sludge wave. This may also
poison those hit.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: sludge-bomb
machine.description:
Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may
also poison the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.description:

combatants except Rock, Ground, and Steel types.

machine.effect:

solar beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: focus-blast
machine.description:
The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes
its power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: fling
machine.description:
The user flings its held item at the target to attack.
This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.name: explosion
machine.description:
The user attacks everything around it by causing a
tremendous explosion. The user faints upon using
this move.
machine.effect: User faints, even if the attack fails or misses.  Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: payback
machine.description:
The user stores power, then attacks. If the user
moves after the target, this attack’s power will
be doubled.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.

machine.name: giga-impact
machine.description:
The user charges at the target using every bit of its
power. The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: rock-polish
machine.description:
The user polishes its body to reduce drag.
This sharply raises the Speed stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

This effect is live; if the user obtains new moves while on the field, these moves become restricted.  If no opposing Pokémon knows any of the user's moves when this move is used, this move will fail.

level-up.name: punishment
level-up.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power starts at 60 and is increased by 20 for every stage any of the target's stats has been raised, capping at 200.  Accuracy and evasion modifiers do not increase this move's power.

level-up.name: bulldoze
level-up.description:
The user strikes everything around it by stomping
down on the ground. This lowers the Speed stats of
those hit.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

level-up.name: rock-throw
level-up.description:
The user picks up and throws a small rock at the
target to attack.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: extrasensory
level-up.description:
The user attacks with an odd, unseeable power.
This may also make the target flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: swords-dance
level-up.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

level-up.name: earth-power
level-up.description:
The user makes the ground under the target erupt
with power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: rock-slide
level-up.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: earthquake
level-up.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

level-up.name: sandstorm
level-up.description:
A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all
combatants except Rock, Ground, and Steel types.
It raises the Sp. Def stat of Rock types.
level-up.effect:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

level-up.name: fissure
level-up.description:
The user opens up a fissure in the ground and drops
the target in. The target faints instantly if this
attack hits.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock on, mind reader, and no guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

level-up.name: stone-edge
level-up.description:
The user stabs the target from below with
sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

level-up.name: hammer-arm
level-up.description:
The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist.
It lowers the user’s Speed, however.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Speed by one stage.

level-up.name: outrage
level-up.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two to three
turns. The user then becomes confused.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

machine.name: fly
machine.description:
The user flies up into the sky and then strikes its target
on the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User flies high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, twister, and whirlwind still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: calm-mind
machine.description:
The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its
spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: bulk-up
machine.description:
The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body,
raising both its Attack and Defense stats.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: hyper-beam
machine.description:
The target is attacked with a powerful beam.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: smack-down
machine.description:
The user throws a stone or similar projectile to
attack the target. A flying Pokémon will fall to the
ground when it’s hit.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the target's immunity to ground-type damage.  This effect removes any existing Ground immunity due to levitate, magnet rise, or telekinesis, and causes the target's flying type to be ignored when it takes Ground damage.

If the target isn't immune to Ground damage, this move will fail.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop, and ends the effect of Bounce or Fly.

machine.name: earthquake
machine.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: dig
machine.description:
The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on
the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: psychic
machine.description:
The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: brick-break
machine.description:
The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break
barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
machine.effect: Destroys any light screen or reflect on the target's side of the field, then inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: sludge-wave
machine.description:
The user strikes everything around it by swamping
the area with a giant sludge wave. This may also
poison those hit.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: sludge-bomb
machine.description:
Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may
also poison the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

solar beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

machine.name: rock-tomb
machine.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers
the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: focus-blast
machine.description:
The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes
its power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: fling
machine.description:
The user flings its held item at the target to attack.
This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.name: explosion
machine.description:
The user attacks everything around it by causing a
tremendous explosion. The user faints upon using
this move.
machine.effect: User faints, even if the attack fails or misses.  Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: payback
machine.description:
The user stores power, then attacks. If the user
moves after the target, this attack’s power will
be doubled.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.

machine.name: giga-impact
machine.description:
The user charges at the target using every bit of its
power. The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: rock-polish
machine.description:
The user polishes its body to reduce drag.
This sharply raises the Speed stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

machine.name: stone-edge
machine.description:
The user stabs the target from below with
sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: swords-dance
machine.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

machine.description:

machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.description:
The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower
the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: bulk-up
machine.description:
The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body,
raising both its Attack and Defense stats.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: hyper-beam
machine.description:
The target is attacked with a powerful beam.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: smack-down
machine.description:
The user throws a stone or similar projectile to
attack the target. A flying Pokémon will fall to the
ground when it’s hit.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the target's immunity to ground-type damage.  This effect removes any existing Ground immunity due to levitate, magnet rise, or telekinesis, and causes the target's flying type to be ignored when it takes Ground damage.

If the target isn't immune to Ground damage, this move will fail.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop, and ends the effect of Bounce or Fly.

machine.name: earthquake
machine.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: psychic
machine.description:
The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: brick-break
machine.description:
The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break
barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
machine.effect: Destroys any light screen or reflect on the target's side of the field, then inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: sludge-wave
machine.description:
The user strikes everything around it by swamping
the area with a giant sludge wave. This may also
poison those hit.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: sludge-bomb
machine.description:
Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may
also poison the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: sandstorm
machine.description:
A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all
combatants except Rock, Ground, and Steel types.
It raises the Sp. Def stat of Rock types.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

machine.name: rock-tomb
machine.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers
the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: focus-blast
machine.description:
The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes
its power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: fling
machine.description:
The user flings its held item at the target to attack.
This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.name: brutal-swing
machine.description:
The user swings its body around violently to inflict
damage on everything in its vicinity.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: explosion
machine.description:
The user attacks everything around it by causing a
tremendous explosion. The user faints upon using
this move.
machine.effect: User faints, even if the attack fails or misses.  Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: payback
machine.description:
The user stores power, then attacks. If the user
moves after the target, this attack’s power will
be doubled.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.

machine.name: giga-impact
machine.description:
The user charges at the target using every bit of its
power. The user can’t move on the next turn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

machine.name: rock-polish
machine.description:
The user polishes its body to reduce drag.
This sharply raises the Speed stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

machine.name: stone-edge
machine.description:
The user stabs the target from below with
sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: swords-dance
machine.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

machine.name: fly
machine.description:
The user flies up into the sky and then strikes its target
on the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User flies high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, twister, and whirlwind still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: bulldoze
machine.description:
The user strikes everything around it by stomping
down on the ground. This lowers the Speed stats of
those hit.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: rock-slide
machine.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.
